author: sky.cactus
content: Search the internet for "stack based virtual machine".  It is a common term in computer science that broadly describes a particular virtual machine architecture.

author: prestance1
content: I know what it is, im just confused to what is its responsibility within a stack based machine <@301186049323958275>

author: sky.cactus
content: It just means that the EVM is a "stack based virtual machine", not a "register based virtual machine" (the two most common types of VMs).

author: gcolvin
content:
More precisely, all computations operate on stack items - not registers or memory. 
 Stack machines can have registers (e.g. JVM, Wasm ...) and register machines can have stacks (e.g. Intel, VAX ...).  Even the EVM has two registers - the program counter and the stack pointer.
